verse: Love the Lord your God and always obey his orders, ·rules [statutes; ordinances; requirements], laws, and commands.

·Remember [You know] today it was not your children who saw and ·felt [experienced; knew] the ·correction [discipline] of the Lord your God. They did not see his ·majesty [greatness], his ·power [strong hand], his ·strength [outstretched arm],
or his signs and the things he did in Egypt to Pharaoh, the king, and his whole country.

They did not see what he did to the Egyptian army, its horses and chariots, when he drowned them in the ·Red [or Reed] Sea [Ex. 10:19] as they were chasing you. The Lord ·ruined [destroyed] them forever.
They did not see what he did for you in the ·desert [wilderness] until you arrived here.

They did not see what he did to Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab the Reubenite, when the ground opened ·up [its mouth] and swallowed them, their ·families [houses], their tents, and everyone who stood ·with them in Israel [on their feet in all Israel; Num. 16].
It was ·you who [your eyes that] saw all these great things the Lord has done.

So ·obey [keep] all the commands I am ·giving [commanding] you today so that you will be strong and can go in and ·take [possess] the land you are ·going to take as your own [crossing over to possess].

Then you will live a long time in the land that the Lord ·promised [swore] to give to your ·ancestors [fathers] and their ·descendants [seed], a ·fertile land [land flowing with milk and honey; Ex. 3:8].
The land you are going to take is not like Egypt, where you were. There you had to plant your seed and water it, like a vegetable garden, by using your feet.
But the land that you will soon cross ·the Jordan River [there] to ·take [possess] is a land of hills and valleys, ·a land that drinks [watered by] rain from heaven.
It is a land the Lord your God ·cares for [looks after]. His eyes are on it continually, and he watches it from the beginning of the year to the end.
If you carefully ·obey [listen to] the commands I am ·giving [commanding] you today and love the Lord your God and serve him with ·your whole being [all your heart/mind and all your soul],
then he will send rain on your land at the right time, in the ·fall [early rain] and ·spring [late rain], and you will be able to gather your grain, new wine, and oil.
He will put grass in the fields for your cattle, and you will have plenty to eat.
Be careful, or you will be ·fooled [tricked; deceived; seduced] and will turn away to serve and worship other gods.

If you do, the Lord will become angry with you and will ·shut [close up] the heavens so it will not rain [1 Kin. 17:1]. Then the land will not ·grow [produce] crops, and you will soon ·die [perish] in the good land the Lord is giving you.

·Remember my words with your whole being [Put these words of mine on your hearts/minds and on your soul]. ·Write them down and tie [Bind] them to your hands as a sign; tie them ·on your foreheads [between your eyes] ·to remind you [as an emblem/headband/frontlet; 6:8].
Teach them well to your children, talking about them when you sit at home and walk along the road, when you lie down and when you get up.
Write them on ·your doors [the lintels/doorposts of your house] and gates
so that both you and your children will live a long time in the land the Lord promised your ·ancestors [fathers], as long as the ·skies [heavens] are above the earth.

If you are careful to obey every command I am ·giving you to follow [commanding you to do], and love the Lord your God, and ·do what he has told you to do [walk on all his ways/paths], and ·are loyal [cling] to him,
then the Lord will ·force [dispossess] all those nations out of the land ahead of you, and you will ·take [possess] the land from nations that are bigger and stronger than you.
Everywhere ·you step [the heel of your foot treads] will be yours. Your land will go from the ·desert [wilderness] to Lebanon and from the Euphrates River to the ·Mediterranean [Great] Sea.

No one will be able to ·stop [stand against] you. The Lord your God will ·do what he promised and will make the people afraid everywhere you go [put the dread and fear of you on all the land on which you tread as he promised].
See, today I am ·letting you choose [setting before you] a blessing or a curse.
You will be blessed if you obey the commands of the Lord your God that I am ·giving [commanding] you today.

But you will be cursed if you ·disobey [do not listen to] the commands of the Lord your God. So do not ·disobey the commands [turn aside from the way] I am ·giving [commanding] you today, and do not ·worship [go after] other gods you do not know.
When the Lord your God brings you into the land you will ·take as your own [possess], you are to announce the blessings from Mount Gerizim and the curses from Mount Ebal [27–28; Josh. 8:30–35].

(·These mountains are [Are they not…?] ·on the other side of [beyond] the Jordan River, to the west, toward the sunset. They are near the great trees of Moreh [Gen. 12:6] in the land of the Canaanites who live in the ·Jordan Valley [Arabah] opposite Gilgal.)
You will soon cross the Jordan River to enter and ·take [possess] the land the Lord your God is giving you. When you ·take it over [possess it] and live there,
be careful to obey all the commands and ·laws [statutes; ordinances; requirements] I am giving you today.
